column4: hi everyone and marry christmas. i have a quick question. is it possible to take a existing ete3 hdd that has one partition and repartition it so that i have two. without loosing any original data
in other words> install ubuntu on a hdd i used for storing data
yes and no - you can repartition but if the data spans both partitions it can be awkward - look into paritioning tools like gpartd
